acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Mecklenburg County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Mecklenburg County was formed in 1764 from Lunenburg County.
Numerous loose records prior to 1783 are missing. Volumes that record deeds, court orders, and wills exist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Deed books, 1768-1776, of Mecklenburg County Court. The deed books record the name of the grantor and grantee, the residence of both individuals and the description of property being sold or transferred. Both volumes have indexes which contains the first and last names of both parties. It is arranged alphabetically from A-Z.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Mecklenburg County Deed Books can be found on microfilm at The Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm."

Mecklenburg County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Mecklenburg Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localites Database found on the Library of Virginia's web site.
